channel.title: Where do i put new commands?

class files are just compiled java files =p kk did u get your command working? if not pm me it and i will[br][size=1]Posted on: July 03, 2007, 08:46:47 PM[/size][hr]tico, thats wrong. he means to view the actual meaning of those symbols. which is not needed

You need to convert them to .text files in which they can be viewed. Remember, google is your friend, use it. http://google.ca

item.source: Where do i put new commands?

item.title: Where do i put new commands?
item.dc:creator: @Kayla_not_good_enoug Kayla (not good enough)
item.description:
@Kayla_not_good_enoug wrote:

Search for pnpc in client.java and u will see this:if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 3) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }directly under the Last “}” add your code so it will look like this:if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 3) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } } CODE

Read full topic
